blocks.text: Example 5.â€”Water is flowing into a large tank at the rate of 200 gallons per min. The reservoir is in the form of a frustum of a cone, the length of the top being 8 ft., and the corresponding dimensions of the base being 12 ft. and 14 ft.; the depth is 12 ft. (see Fig. 17). At what rate is the level of the water rising when the depth of water is 4 ft.

blocks.caption: Fig. 17
blocks.description: The figure represents a frustum of a cone illustrating the dimensions and the water level.

blocks.text: In 12 ft. the length decreases by 20 ft., and therefore in 8 ft. the length when the water is at 4 ft. is given by the relationship.

blocks.description: This equation represents the change in volume of the water with respect to time.

blocks.text: Similarly, the breadth = 32 ft. and height = 18 ft. .
